name: ListPurchaseOrders
description:
Retrieve a list of purchase orders.

Call this tool to obtain a list of current purchase orders. It can be used to view all purchase order details, including their statuses and related information.

parameters.name: purchase_order_creation_source
parameters.description: Specifies the origin of the purchase order. Options include ACCOUNTING_PROVIDER, DEVELOPER_API, or RAMP.

value_schema.description: Creation source of the purchase order.

parameters.name: filter_from_created_date
parameters.description: Filter purchase orders created after a specified date. Expected format is ISO 8601 (YYYY-MM-DD).

value_schema.description: Filter for purchase orders that were requested after the given date.

parameters.name: filter_before_creation_date
parameters.description: Filter for purchase orders requested before this date. Format: YYYY-MM-DD.

value_schema.description: Filter for purchase orders that were requested before the given date.

parameters.name: receipt_status
parameters.description: Specify the receipt status of the purchase order. Options are: FULLY_RECEIVED, NOT_RECEIVED, OVER_RECEIVED, PARTIALLY_RECEIVED.

value_schema.description: Receipt status of the purchase order.

parameters.name: pagination_start_id
parameters.description: The ID of the last entity from the previous page to retrieve the next page of results.

value_schema.description: The ID of the last entity of the previous page, used for pagination to get the next page.

parameters.name: results_per_page
parameters.description: Sets the number of purchase orders returned per page. Must be between 2 and 100, default is 20.

value_schema.description: The number of results to be returned in each page. The value must be between 2 and 100. If not specified, the default value 20 will be used.

parameters.name: business_entity_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the associated business entity.

value_schema.description: Unique identifier for the associated business entity.

parameters.name: spend_request_identifier
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the spend request linked to the purchase order.

value_schema.description: Unique identifier for the spend request associated with the purchase order.

parameters.name: three_way_match_enabled
parameters.description: Set to true to enable three-way match for the purchase order.

value_schema.description: Whether three-way match is enabled for the purchase order.

parameters.name: include_archived_orders
parameters.description: Set to true to include archived purchase orders. Defaults to false.

value_schema.description: Whether to include archived purchase orders. By default, include_archived is false.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the ramp API.

parameters.description: Creation source of the purchase order.

value_schema.description: Creation source of the purchase order.

value_schema.description: Filter for purchase orders that were requested after the given date.

parameters.description: Filter for purchase orders that were requested before the given date.

value_schema.description: Filter for purchase orders that were requested before the given date.

parameters.name: receipt_status
parameters.description: Receipt status of the purchase order.

value_schema.description: Receipt status of the purchase order.

parameters.description: The ID of the last entity of the previous page, used for pagination to get the next page.

value_schema.description: The ID of the last entity of the previous page, used for pagination to get the next page.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of results to be returned in each page. The value must be between 2 and 100. If not specified, the default value 20 will be used.

value_schema.description: The number of results to be returned in each page. The value must be between 2 and 100. If not specified, the default value 20 will be used.

parameters.name: entity_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the associated business entity.

value_schema.description: Unique identifier for the associated business entity.

parameters.description: Unique identifier for the spend request associated with the purchase order.

value_schema.description: Unique identifier for the spend request associated with the purchase order.

value_schema.description: Whether three-way match is enabled for the purchase order.

parameters.description: Whether to include archived purchase orders. By default, include_archived is false.

value_schema.description: Whether to include archived purchase orders. By default, include_archived is false.
